node.title: Saudi agent suspected of Jamal Khashoggi killing arrested at French airport
node.description: The man, a former Royal Guard of Saudi Arabia, was reportedly arrested by authorities at Charles de Gaulle airport near Paris as he was about to board a flight to Saudi capital Riyadh.

node.title: Major blow for England on eve of Ashes
node.description: England have suffered a major blow on the eve of the first Ashes cricket test against Australia with pace bowler James Anderson ruled out with a calf injury. The opening...

node.title: Public servants paid over $400k almost double in year
node.description: The number of public servants earning more than $400,000 annually has almost doubled in the last year.

node.title: Rohingya sue Facebook for $150 billion over Myanmar hate speech
node.description: Coordinated lawsuits in the U.S. and the U.K. allege the tech giant contributed to ethnic cleansing by allowing hate speech to be spread on its platform.

node.title: Amanda Gorman on new book, and why she still feels like an "outsider"
node.description: At 22, Amanda Gorman became the youngest poet ever to perform their work at a U.S. presidential inauguration.

node.title: A Landmark Photo Archive of Black Life in New York Comes to the Met
node.description: With the Studio Museum in Harlem, the Met will acquire and conserve thousands of photographs by James Van Der Zee, the virtuoso portraitist who brought to life the optimism of the Harlem Renaissance.

node.title: If James Madison Weighed In on Politics Today
node.description: Readers discuss James Madison and the role of Congress today. Also: Expanding the fight for abortion rights; a proposal for the National Mall.

node.title: Stellantis will spend $34 billion on software and new vehicles.
node.description: The automaker plans to develop new vehicles based on software that will let it sell entertainment, navigation and other subscription services to buyers of its cars and trucks.

node.title: In a Reversal, Meadows Refuses to Cooperate With Jan. 6 Inquiry
node.description: The former White House chief of staff told the House panel scrutinizing the Capitol attack that he was no longer willing to be interviewed, reversing a commitment he made last week.

node.title: Chile Legalizes Same-Sex Marriage at Fraught Political Moment
node.description: The battle to legalize same-sex marriage in Chile began more than a decade ago and it comes to an end as the candidates vying to run Chile are at odds on the issue.

node.title: With Putin-Biden meeting, skirmishes break out between Ukrainian soldiers and Russian-backed separatists.
node.description: The exchange of fire on the “line of contact” in Ukraine was not unusual, but offered a reminder that, for those on the front line, the grinding war is part of daily life.,

node.title: Woman Chokes to Death at Restaurant After Eating Octopus
node.description: Diners and staff members were unable to resuscitate the 63-year-old, who had been having lunch with a relative.

node.title: China Riled by Lloyd Austin, Antony Blinken After Supportive Taiwan Remarks
node.description: Departing from State Department guidelines last week, Secretary Blinken described Taiwan as a country for the third time publicly this year.

node.title: Redditor Says Bride Asked Guests to Help Pay for Wedding in Viral Post
node.description: The Redditor said that their friend "mentioned that [the bride] will be sending us her Venmo so that we could 'pitch in' for the wedding."

node.title: Instagram Introducing Tool Allowing Parents to Monitor How Much Time Kids Spend on App
node.description: The two new features will allow users to monitor and limit time spent on the social media app, both for themselves and their children.

node.title: Omicron Likely More Transmissible Than Delta but Not More Severe, Dr. Anthony Fauci Says
node.description: While more information is needed, Fauci said it seems like the world will avoid the "worst-case scenario" with the Omicron variant.

node.title: Cane re-signs with NZ Rugby, Chiefs and Bay of Plenty
node.description: The All Blacks, Chiefs and Bay of Plenty loose forward Sam Cane has recommitted to New Zealand Rugby to the end of 2025.

node.title: Turning youth prisons into Covid-19 wards 'dreadful mistake'
node.description: Families of young men who spent time in the Hawke's Bay Regional Prison Youth Unit are devastated it could be adapted for quarantine.

node.title: Meadows says he won't cooperate with January 6 committee
node.description: Meadows said he believes the courts will be forced to weigh in on the dispute over executive privilege.

node.title: Epstein accuser wants Maxwell "behind bars for the rest of her life"
node.description: Sarah Ransome said she was recruited into Jeffrey Epstein's alleged sex trafficking ring in 2006 when she was just 22.

node.title: Man admits to another killing just before his execution
node.description: David Neal Cox said he killed his sister-in-law in 2007 and provided detailed instructions on where investigators could find her remains, a prosecutor said.

node.title: Basking in a Vegan Caribbean at Aunts et Uncles in Brooklyn
node.description: Plant-based menus have become the new hubs of culinary creativity, and this bright all-day cafe offers plenty.

node.title: Drake Removes Himself From Competition for 2022 Grammy Awards
node.description: The superstar rapper and singer, long a critic of the awards, was nominated in two categories, best rap album and best rap performance.

node.title: A Family Shatters Along With Yugoslavia
node.description: “Where You Come From,” by Sasa Stanisic, is an autobiographical novel about a life uprooted by war.

node.title: Artists Rally to Preserve Black History in Sag Harbor
node.description: A pop-up exhibition is helping a historical society conserve its archive of the Black experience in beach communities facing increased gentrification.

node.title: Kellogg Workers Prolong Strike by Rejecting Contract Proposal
node.description: About 1,400 workers have been on strike since Oct. 5 at four Kellogg cereal plants in the United States over a dispute that has revolved around the company’s two-tier compensation structure.

node.title: More Terence Blanchard Coming to Met Opera After Success of ‘Fire’
node.description: Following the composer’s milestone “Fire Shut Up in My Bones” this season, the company will stage his earlier “Champion” in 2023.

node.title: This Robot Looks Like a Pancake and Jumps Like a Maggot
node.description: Researchers designed a soft, legless robot that can hop and navigate obstacle courses.

node.title: Ukraine Says Russia Sending Snipers, Tanks to Border to 'Provoke Return Fire' From Its Troops
node.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin and U.S. President Joe Biden are expected to discuss Ukraine tensions during a high-stakes video call Tuesday.

node.title: Share of Wealth Held by 10 Percent of World's Richest Hits Historic Levels Amid Pandemic
node.description: "Global inequalities seem to be about as great today as they were at the peak of Western imperialism in the early 20th century," said the World Inequality Report.
